subject: RE: [junit] Code Snippet Test
msgSnippet: Are you trying to get us to do your homework, or help you pass an interview?  Either way, you neglected to include the code you re trying to test or the FAQ
messageBody:
Are you trying to get us to do your homework, or help you pass an
interview? Either way, you neglected to include the code you're trying
to test or the "FAQ section". Maybe I'm confused about what kind of
"help" you are looking for in this case.


Todd.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Megh
> Sent: Wednesday, July 16, 2008 10:07 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Code Snippet Test
>
> Dear Collegues,
>
> Any help in this regard will be highly appreciated (ASAP).
>
>
> Instructions:
>
> Please read the FAQ section and do the following:
>
> List as many testcases as possible. (List at a high-level of
> what your are checking for and the expected results, e.g.,
> verify x returns y and so forth.) Then take any one of the
> testcases and conform it to a junit test code. (In other
> words, I should be able to literally take their code and run
> it with JUnit framework.) [FAQ] 1. What is package
> SpringConfig used for?
>
>
> 2. What does myException do?
>
> 3. Does the error code mappings dynamically change during runtime?
>
>
> 4. Does the spring framework get loaded only once during startup?
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>
>
